Body.Content:
Updated July 8, 2025: We have updated this message with additional information. Thank you for your feedback.

We’re introducing the next evolution of Copilot in Engage—transforming it from a writing assistant into a personalized AI companion. This enhanced experience helps users stay informed, discover insights, and recall important information across their network.

This change is associated with Microsoft 365 Roadmap ID: 481282 

When this will happen:

General Availability (Worldwide): Rollout begins end of July 2025. And we expect to complete the rollout by the end of August 2025

How this affects your organization:

Users with a Microsoft 365 Copilot license will gain access to new capabilities in Engage, including:

  • Community Catch-Up: Stay current on conversations, trending content, and key updates in your network.
  • Information Discovery: Find relevant insights and answers from colleagues, communities, and storylines.
  • Recall: Retrieve past conversations, updates, and shared knowledge quickly.

These features are built on the Avalon/M365 Copilot platform and leverage Microsoft Graph data for a deeply integrated experience.

Note: Users without a Microsoft 365 Copilot license will not have access to these enhanced capabilities.

What you can do to prepare:

  • Review licensing: Ensure users who need access are assigned the Microsoft 365 Copilot license.
  • Communicate the change: Let users know about the new capabilities and how they can benefit from them.
  • Update training materials: Reflect the new Copilot experience in Engage.

Compliance considerations:

  • Stores new customer data Yes
  • Alters how existing customer data is processed, stored, or accessed Yes
  • Introduces or modifies AI/ML capabilities that interact with customer data Yes
  • Provides new ways of interacting with generative AI Yes
  • Modifies or disables Purview capabilities (DLP, labels, audit, etc.) Maybe
  • Alters admin compliance monitoring or reporting Maybe
  • Modifies how users access/export/delete/correct personal data (GDPR) Maybe
